properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 11:19AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following river in Illinois...Kentucky...

Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam

.Heavy rainfall earlier this week along the Ohio and Tennessee River
Valleys has caused river levels to rise. Flooding is forecast to begin
at Olmsted tomorrow with a crest over a week away.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam.
* from Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* At 11:00 AM Friday the stage was 34.2 feet.
* Flood Stage is 36.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by tomorrow afternoon and
continue to rise to near 41.5 feet by February 16.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
